intro: Manothrix valida, commonly known as the silverleaf manothrix, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with erect stems and lanceolate leaves. It produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, which are followed by dry, three-lobed fruits. Manothrix valida is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
